forecast.name: Christmas Day
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 55, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. West northwest wind 3 to 7 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 10pm. Mostly cloudy. Low around 50, with temperatures rising to around 52 overnight. South southwest wind 6 to 12 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the morning light drifts lazily over Downtown San Francisco, the scene is painted with a gentle palette of muted grays and soft blues, underscored by clouds that hint at a whimsical dance with the impending rain. Though Christmas Day begins with an invitation to venture outdoors—mostly sunny conditions and a pleasant chill—there lies a whisper of change beneath the surface. By evening, the clouds will deepen in color and texture, promising rain to arrive with the twilight around 10 p.m., as the winds pick up strength from the south-southwest.

In this moment, the city feels both calm and anticipatory. The absence of fog allows the outlines of landmarks to emerge clearly, from the iconic silhouette of the Golden Gate Bridge to the bustling heart of Downtown, offering an invigorating atmosphere for a stroll or a quiet cup of coffee in one of the many cozy cafes. One might choose to wrap themselves in layers—perhaps a light jacket over a sweater—and take a leisurely walk along the waterfront, where the soft lap of waves and the salty air create a refreshingly serene escape. The day holds the promise of coziness ahead, as the rising evening temperatures signify the approach of rain, a gentle reminder to prepare for a night spent indoors, perhaps with a good book or a warm meal awaiting.
